HWBgpAfi.description: Address Family Identifier(AFI) for BGP peer.
HWBgpAfi.name: HWBgpAfi

HWBgpSafi.description: Subsequent Address Family Identifier(SAFI) for BGP peer.
HWBgpSafi.name: HWBgpSafi

MplsL3VpnName.description: An identifier that is assigned to each MPLS/BGP VPN and is used to uniquely identify it. This is assigned by the system operator or NMS and SHOULD be unique throughout the MPLS domain. If this is the case, then this identifier can then be used at any LSR within a specific MPLS domain to identify this MPLS/BGP VPN. It may also be possible to preserve the uniqueness of this identifier across MPLS domain boundaries, in which case this identifier can then be used to uniquely identify MPLS/BGP VPNs on a more global basis. This object MAY be set to the VPN ID as defined in RFC 2685.
MplsL3VpnName.name: MplsL3VpnName
MplsL3VpnName.reference: RFC 2685 Fox B., et al, 'Virtual Private Networks Identifier', September 1999.

hwBgpCompliance.description: The compliance statement for Huawei-BGP-VPN MIB
hwBgpCompliance.name: hwBgpCompliance

hwBgpMIB.contactinfo: Huawei Industrial Base Bantian, Longgang Shenzhen 518129 People's Republic of China Website: http://www.huawei.com Email: support@huawei.com
hwBgpMIB.description: The Mib module for management of BGP/VPN. Huawei Technologies co.,Ltd. Supplementary information may be available at: http://www.huawei.com
hwBgpMIB.name: hwBgpMIB

revisions.description: Add two trap node for sending the number threshold alarms of BGP peers, include: 'hwBgpPeerSessionNumMaxNum', 'hwBgpPeerSessionNumMaxExceed', 'hwBgpPeerSessionNumMaxClear'
Add some trap nodes for sending BGP routes threshold alarms, include: 'hwBgpRouteThresholdExceed', 'hwBgpRouteThresholdClear', 'hwBgpRouteMaxExceed', 'hwBgpRouteMaxClear'.

Add some MIB nodes for getting BGP protocol resource information, include: 'hwBgpPeerSessionNum', 'hwIBgpPeerSessionNum', 'hwEBgpPeerSessionNum', 'hwConfiguredVrfs', 'hwConfiguredIpv4Vrfs','hwConfiguredIpv6Vrfs'.

hwBgpPeer.description: BGP Peer Group. This table contains members of the connections with BGP peers.

hwBgpPeerConfig.description: Configuration Group for BGP Peers. This table contains members of the configurations of BGP peers.

hwBgpPeerConfigEntry.description: This object indicates the configurations of BGP peers.

hwBgpPeerConfigRouteLimitNum.description: This object indicates the maximum number of routes received from the BGP peer.
hwBgpPeerConfigRouteLimitNum.name: hwBgpPeerConfigRouteLimitNum

hwBgpPeerConfigRouteLimitThreshold.description: This object indicates the alarm threshold (%) of the maximum number of routes received from the BGP peer.
hwBgpPeerConfigRouteLimitThreshold.name: hwBgpPeerConfigRouteLimitThreshold

hwBgpPeerConfigTable.description: BGP Peer Configuration Table. This table contains the configurations of BGP peers.

hwBgpPeerEntry.description: The information about the connections with BGP peers.

hwBgpPeerEstablished.description: The BGP Established event is generated when the BGP FSM enters the ESTABLISHED state.

hwBgpPeerFsmEstablishedCounter.description: The Counter That Records the Times the Remote BGP Peer Is Correctly Connected The counter is increased by one if the remote BGP peer is correctly connected once. The counter could be set to zero.
hwBgpPeerFsmEstablishedCounter.name: hwBgpPeerFsmEstablishedCounter

hwBgpPeerFsmEstablishedTime.description: The counter that records the times the remote BGP peer is correctly connected.
hwBgpPeerFsmEstablishedTime.name: hwBgpPeerFsmEstablishedTime

hwBgpPeerGRStatus.description: Graceful restart status of the BGP peer, including: 1: peerNotBeingHelped, indicating that the BGP peer will not be helped during restarting. 2: peerRestarting, indicating that the BGP peer is detected restarting. 3: peerFinishRestart, indicating that the BGP peer finishes the latest GR. 4: peerHelping, indicating that the BGP peer is helping the local end to perform GR.
hwBgpPeerGRStatus.name: hwBgpPeerGRStatus

hwBgpPeerGRStatusChange.description: This notification is generated when the graceful restart status described by hwBgpPeerGRStatus changes.
hwBgpPeerGRStatusChange.name: hwBgpPeerGRStatusChange

hwBgpPeerLastError.description: The last error code and subcode seen by this peer on this connection. If no error has occurred, this field is zero. Otherwise, the first byte of this two byte OCTET STRING contains the error code, and the second byte contains the subcode.
hwBgpPeerLastError.name: hwBgpPeerLastError

hwL3vpnVrfRouteMidThreshCleared.description: This notification is generated when the number of routes contained by the specified VRF exceeds the value indicated by mplsL3VpnVrfMidRouteThreshold, and then falls below this value. A single notification MUST be generated when this threshold is exceeded, and no other notifications of this type should be issued until the value of mplsL3VpnVrfPerfCurrNumRoutes has fallen below that of mplsL3VpnVrfConfMidRteThresh.
hwL3vpnVrfRouteMidThreshCleared.name: hwL3vpnVrfRouteMidThreshCleared

hwTnl2VpnTrapEvent.description: This trap indicates whether the tunnel used by a VPN is reachable, If the tunnel is unreachable, a trap is sent to notify the user, hwTunnelReachablityEvent is 2. If the tunnel is reachable, a trap is sent to notify the user, hwTunnelReachablityEvent is 1.
